net.sf.jclec.algorithm

Class PSOAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.jclec.algorithm.AbstractAlgorithm
      • net.sf.jclec.algorithm.PSOAlgorithm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, net.sf.jclec.IAlgorithm, net.sf.jclec.IConfigure, net.sf.jclec.JCLEC
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MOPSOAlgorithm

    public abstract class PSOAlgorithm
extends net.sf.jclec.algorithm.AbstractAlgorithm
    An abstract algorithm implementing the PSO paradigm. It implements a general PSO optimizer where a swarm is comprised of particles that are moved according to their current velocity. Characteristics like the number and influence of leaders, the mechanism to update velocities in each generation and the possibility to add variation operators should be defined by concrete classes. This class does not assume any contextualization mechanism.

    HISTORY:

    • (AR|JRR|SV, 1.0, March 2018) First release.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Aurora Ramirez (AR), Jose Raul Romero (JRR), Sebastian Ventura (SV)

    Knowledge Discovery and Intelligent Systems (KDIS) Research Group: http://www.uco.es/grupos/kdis

    See Also:
    AbstractAlgorithm, IPopulation, Serialized Form
